meanings.definition: Having a slanting edge or surface for joining two surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The beveled mirror reflected the light in a unique way.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used a beveled edge to create a seamless joint.
meanings.sent3: The beveled picture frame made the painting look like it was leaning forward.
meanings.sent4: Her beveled smile added a touch of elegance to her face.
meanings.sent5: The beveled glass door sparkled in the sunlight, creating a dazzling effect.

meanings.definition: To cut or shape an edge at an angle.
meanings.sent1: He carefully beveled the edges of the wood to fit them together perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor beveled the marble to give it a smooth finish.
meanings.sent3: She beveled the cake slices to create a fancy presentation.
meanings.sent4: The artist beveled the lines in the drawing to add depth and dimension.
meanings.sent5: Beveling the metal edges made the structure more sturdy and secure.

meanings.definition: A surface that is slanted or sloping.
meanings.sent1: The beveled edge of the table gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent2: She admired the beveled surface of the crystal vase.
meanings.sent3: The beveled hill made for a challenging hike.
meanings.sent4: The beveled roof allowed rainwater to easily slide off.
meanings.sent5: The beveled edge of the cliff created a stunning view of the valley below.
